alert.note: Alert for Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 15 at 4:46AM CDT until September 15 at 12:38PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Lubbock TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Double Mountain Fork Brazos near Lubbock 4ESE affecting Lubbock County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT THIS MORNING TO EARLY THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Double Mountain Fork Brazos near Lubbock 4ESE downstream to Buffalo Springs and Ransom Canyon. * WHEN...This morning to early afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding is possible on FM 835 crossing the river at the upper end of Buffalo Springs Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM CDT Friday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1245 PM CDT.
